We can blame a lot of things on York Sport, the weather is not one of them

(Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

University of York Clay Pigeon Shooting Club

Sports Editor Adam Shergold spends an afternoon with one of York's newest clubs, who in just two terms have grown from humble beginnings to target national success

College players speak out as rain stops play

College Football captains have criticised the quality of pitches on the 22 Acres and the organisation of the Autumn League after the cancellation of three rounds of fixtures through poor weather (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Futsal firsts sparkle in second regional heats of National BUCS Championships

York's futsal firsts got their season back on track with two wins in the second regional heats of the BUCS Futsal Championships. Victories against the University of Manchester and Edge Hill seconds gave York six points and put them in a commanding position in Group D (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Jason Lozier)

Mid-season Review - Men's Football

With the teams of UYAFC fighting for honours on all fronts, Adam Shergold asks the captains to take stock of the season to date (Thumbnail credit Photograph by George Lowther)

Mid-season Review - Netball

As the BUCS season approaches it's winter break, Adam Shergold looks at how our netball teams have fared so far (Thumbnail credit Photographs by Justyn Hardcastle)

Netball seconds' promotion hopes suffer Newcastle setback

Wednesday's 46-39 defeat against Newcastle allowed the North-East university to stretch their lead at the top of BUCS League 5B to six points (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

Newcastle consign Netball firsts to defeat in enthralling encounter

York were unable to move off the bottom of BUCS Division 4B despite leading for long periods against Newcastle on Wednesday (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Jason Lozier)

Squash firsts' fightback not enough against superb Sheffield

A poor start cost the men's squash firsts in their match against the University of Sheffield. (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Jason Lozier)

Manchester expose York's weaknesses in men's volleyball

York need to return to the drawing board after suffering another straight sets defeat, this time to a superb Manchester side, on Wednesday (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Hallam win has women's volleyball dreaming of promotion

A 3-1 victory over Sheffield Hallam on Wednesday has turned BUCS League 2B into a promotion shoot-out between York and Newcastle (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Glory for women's fencing as BUCS League is wrapped up

Today's comfortable win over Northumbria made it six wins out of six for the women's fencing team, securing their place in the BUCS League play-offs (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Jason Lozier)

Wednesday Round-up - 2nd December

Despite a number of cancellations, there was still plenty of sports action on campus today. Nouse rounds up the best of the day's action. (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Jason Lozier)

College Notebook: The critical importance of Dodgeball

With Sunday's annual dodgeball tournament worth as many College Sport points as an entire term's football or rugby, Thomas Gibby argues that some kind of balance needs to be struck

YUsnow back up BUDS points with King's League success

By James Bithell

An experienced YUsnow team achieved a second place finish in the third round of the King's League on Saturday, the perfect follow-up to last weekend's positives at the BUDS Championships in Edinburgh (Thumbnail credit Dave Tee, YUsnow's first-year England Team representative, at the BUDS Championships in Edinburgh. Photographs by Louise Cotrel-Gibbons)

Flooding and icy conditions create fun and games for Boat Club

By James Bithell

With the River Ouse approaching bursting point and temperatures plummeting, it was with a sense of great relief that the senior Boat Club crews could return to competitive action this weekend (Thumbnail credit Photographs by John Appleton)

Weather puts paid to College Football Sunday

Heavy overnight rainfall has caused the postponement of Sunday morning's College Football fixtures and created concerns over fixture congestion as the season reaches its finale. (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Lacrosse seconds off the mark with Northumbria win

Wednesday's 10-4 victory over Northumbria, built on the four goals of Rachel Ellis, has ignited the women's seconds season (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

Referee, strong winds and misfortune conspire against Football fourths

York were the victims of some rather dubious officiating on Wednesday afternoon, as their counterparts from Hull won 7-1 in a BUCS League 6D encounter

Last-gasp victory keeps seconds' title hopes burning

A fourth quarter revival against Leeds Trinity, when the match had seemed lost, kept York's seconds hot on the heels of Newcastle in the BUCS League 5B promotion battle (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

Henry handball fiasco brings television replay debate into sharp focus

The furore resulting from Thierry Henry's handball against Ireland last Wednesday has again raised the question of whether television replays should be introduced. And not before time too, argues Jake Farrell. (Thumbnail credit The Republic of Ireland were denied a place in next Summer's World Cup finals by Thierry Henry's deliberate handball last week)

Wednesday Round-up: November 25th

There were wins for the women's hockey firsts and men's football seconds, but the rugby firsts suffered their second loss of the season at Leeds (Thumbnail credit Photo: Peter Iveson)

Men's volleyball team fail to derail Leeds Met

York men's volleyball firsts were defeated by Leeds Met Carnegie, but can take positives from a valiant effort against one of the country's top teams. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

Excellent women's hockey firsts storm past Northumbria

York's ladies cruised to a comfortable 2-0 victory over Northumbria University seconds this afternoon with goals from Rachael Faustino and Emily Lucas. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Peter Iveson)

Badminton firsts held in tight encounter

York badminton firsts fought their way to a 4-4 draw against second in the league Sheffield University earlier today (Thumbnail credit Photo: Sam Newsome)
